question: Which of the following statements is correct about the value of acceleration due to gravity (g) in a light and heavy falling body?
option1: the value of g will be greater in the light body
option2: the value of g will be greater in the heavy body
option3: the value of g will be equal in both the bodies
option4: the value of g depends on the mass
answer: the value of g will be equal in both the bodies
explanation: Acceleration due to gravity is independent of mass, shape, size etc. of falling body. Therefore, a light and heavy body will have equal acceleration.
